ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a good understanding for Indonesian culture. Expanded my vocabulary significantly in terms of verbs and connectors.
I learned more depth about the grammar, vocabulary, reading, writing, and speaking skills in the Indonesian language. It was definitely a step up from levels 1 and 2, and it was very rewarding.
I learned a lot about Indonesian culture as well as the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course had a great atmosphere and was very conducive to a positive learning environment. At times, it was a little disorganized, but never too the point where it felt like I was getting low marks due to disorganization.

Strengths: Bu Dinny is an amazing teacher, she cares about her students, is very funny, and explains topics very well. The content was really interesting, and I liked how we learned new things about Indonesian culture with every grammar topic.
Weakness: The class itself could be a bit more structured (i.e. a structured syllabus) -- but no real weaknesses
I think this course was perfect
Fun sections and texts you can prepare for.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend Indonesian to any student. Loved my professors and my classmates every year. Great supportive environment.
Yes, though if you're considering it you probably have to take it to fulfill your language requirement. Bu Dinny is great!
If you want a language course that is relatively low workload with a great teacher and peers -- take this class. Very interesting topics, very engaging learning and fun activities.
Yes I would because the professor does a great job making you want to learn and go to class
